comm: full and straight to start. 141 kph. Some swing, just enough swing. Yorker first up, outside off. Charles jams it out
more swing. Angled away from the right-hander and quite wide outside off, flayed to third man. Bat away from body

whew. Massive appeal. That looked out. A full swinging yorker. And Smith reviews. he has to. That looked plumb. Big inside edge on that on closer inspection.But wow, what a start fro Starc. back to his swinging best right away. Somehow, from somewhere Fletcher got bat on that
oh my. What an over so far already. A very high full toss outside off. No ball called. Fletcher goes after it and gets a thick outside edge towards first slip. Smith hurries out of the way
full on middle, inswing. Slogged to mid-on. Couldn't quite get under the free hit to get that away

gone. Whoa. Some start this. Full and wide outside off, not a lot of swing but enough. Fletcher wafts at it aimlessly and the skew flies to backward point. Comfortable height and comfortably taken. Starc has a wicket in his first over on international return
nice and straight, 147 kph. Bravo presents the full face of the bat to block
fullish and wide to start. A good start. Some away shape. Left alone
135 kph. Nice. Full and wide again, inviting the drive. Charles accepts the invitation, but cannot connect
fullish on off, blocked. Not much swing there
nice lengths these. Nagging away outside Charles' off stump. Defended
shortish this time, a sixth-stump line. Swatted to mid-on
full and straight, a thick inside edge to fine leg gets Charles one
nicely played. Full on off, not a lot of movement. Driven into the off side, through the covers, for a couple
edged and flies away to third man. 141 kph. Intentionally bowling it quite full to extract as much swing from the air as possible
leg side-ish, a fantastic save from Wade. Clipped the pads and looked like it was four leg byes but Wade got across
driven into the cover region. Quite tentative outside the off stump
strays in line again. Drifts down leg for an extra
shortish and wide, left alone
full and straight, very full. Jammed to fine leg off the inside edge
nice lines. Fullish and wide outside off, Bravo leaves alone
nice again. Full and wide, some late outswing. Bravo leaves happily
a tad straighter and flicked to fine leg to get one
a good length on middle. Charles tries to flick but misses and is struck on the midriff. A bit late on the nudge
fullish on a fourth-stump line. Blocked. Dead bat

edged and dropped. Not easy at all. Fullish and wide again, Charles gives it his all with a flashy drive. A thick outside edge flies over Smith at first slip who leaps but can only parry it to the boundary. Good effort
uh oh. 147.4 kph. A naughty full toss outside off, Bravo leans on the drive and gets it through the point area. Scurries across the slow outfield. Swung in the air though
and now down the leg side. Wide
nicely bowled. Gets his line right. Full and wide outside off, just enough away movement to take the ball past the outside edge
too wide again. This time way outside off stump. Another wide called
a good length on middle and leg, 145 kph. Tucked to square leg
superbly played. Full and wide, too full, overpitched. Bravo lays into the drive and crisply times it to the cover boundary
another full toss on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on. Maybe time to give him a break
fullish length outside off and Bravo shoulders arms
full again. Charles lunges forward to defend
a good length on middle is swivel-flicked to fine leg
no-ball. Hazlewood oversteps. Full on middle, driven to mid-on.
smashed. Clobbered away. Hazlewod digs it in on middle, Bravo backs away and hammers the pull to the square leg boundary. Shot!
shortish and wide, Bravo goes back and tries to punch a drive but the slowness of the pitch means he miscues to cover
a good run. Good length on middle, inside-edged to square leg for a quick single. Well done
defended from the crease
nicely tossed up on middle, fluently driven to cover. Too full there
better. Shortens the length outside off and extracts plenty of turn. Slapped to deep cover

massive appeal. Whew, that was close. Flat on middle and off, the ball skids on with the arm and Charles misses a flick. That looked out. The umpire Gregory Brathwaite says no. Did that pitch in line? I thought so. Carried on with the arm, good delivery
worked to fine leg
a massive slog attempted but the ball spins and hits the pad down the leg side
slides down leg for an extra
starts it off wider outside off, tucked to fine leg from off and middle stump
overpitched on off, driven to mid-on
full and wide, mis-timed to mid-on
quite full on off and driven to mid-off for a run. To Warner. Good single
just wide of a diving cover. More evidence of the slowness of the pitch. Full and wide, Bravo is through the drive too early, the ball lobs up and just evades a diving Smith at cover
tapped into the cover region
pulled to square leg, dragged the stroke from outside off
a tad too short outside off, Bravo rocks back and smashed the cross-batted slap to deep cover
another close shout. Full outside off, brings Charles forward who gets a thin edge on his half-willed prod
uses his feet, runs to the pitch of the ball and slogs it over midwicket. The execution aided by the steps to the pitch of the ball
flat on middle, a thick inside edge onto his pad. Otherwide that was out
nicely bowled. Tossed up outside off, left alone
too short again, thrashed to deep cover off the back foot
full and wide, left alone
shortens the length and brings it closer to off stump. Bravo goes back and eases into a defensive stroke into the off side
fullish length outside off, another leave
short and wide, there for the cut, Bravo goes after it but fails to connect
shot! Overpitched outside off, fluently driven to mid-off
maiden. Nice over. Full and wide again, Bravo doesn't interfere
tossed up outside off, Charles strides forward and defends
another big swing but the spin takes the ball away from the bat. Thuds into his body
another edge. Looking very tentative here. Flatter outside off, a thin edge from Charles into his pad
clever bowling. Slower on middle but short enough. Charles misses a flick, the ball hits his pad down leg
another edgy stroke. Flat down leg, tickled fine, more off the inside half. To fine leg for a couple
good over that. Run-scoring getting increasingly harder. Turned to backward square leg

poor shot. Full and wide, Bravo lays into a drive but fails to keep it down. Hits an uppish drive but straight to extra cover who juggles it and then takes it inches away from the ground. Not sure what he was trying to do there, maybe through the stroke too early
overpitched outside off, solidly blocked
good field-placing. Shortish delivery outside off is guided towards third man but a gully stops the single. keeps Samuels on 0
another overpitched delivery is just jammed into the off side
superb change-up. Goes short and surprises Samuels who sways out of the line quite late. Nice direction on that
strays down leg, allowing Samuels to tickle it towards fine leg for three. Well played, good diving stop too
down leg again, Wade cannot collect cleanly, allows the extra run
another big appeal, but that didn't look out. Too much turn. Quite flat outside off, the ball rips back in toward Charles who misses it again. Sliding down
comes down the track and thrashes a drive to mid-off
intriguing battle this. Lyon sees Charles coming and shortens the length. Charles comes down and slogs it on the bounce to deep midwicket
worked to fine leg
this one drifts away from the bat, beaten on the outside edge outside off stump. Nice bowling

lovely bowling. Very full on middle and off, Charles misses it yet again. Quite bewildering that there wasn't much of an appeal. There was something from Lyon. Leg byes, maybe too much turn again but that looked close
straight away down leg for a wide

bowled im. That's why he was brought back. Charles' struggling innings ends. A superb yorker again, not for the first time Charles gets an inside edge but this time it rattled into middle stump. Late swing back in. Superb stuff from Starc
a low full toss on leg. Looking for the yorker again, bunted to mid-on
nice bowling. Attacking the base of those stumps, pushed to mid-on.
not quite the bouncer but short outside off, upper cut to third man for a run
looking for the yorker again but misses. A low full toss is sliced away past point. A superb acrobatic effort from Lyon at sweeper cover saves two runs
full and straight, blocked
flat on middle, Ramdin hangs back to defend
straight to short leg, those ones only stick. Flat down leg, worked to Finch's ankle at short leg. Got up too early. Why is Finch there?
worked away to fine leg
flat on off, not much turn. Pushed to midwicket
slower and straighter, easily whipped to deep square leg
strays down leg again, nudged with soft hands towards fine leg for a couple
drifts down leg for yet another extra. Wade mis-collects as well
full and straight, Samuels is hurries for pace but manages a defensive pat back
146 kph, full on off. Blocked
a loose stroke. Full and wide, Samuels drives away from his body. Lobs it up to sweeper cover
nice and full again, attacking the stumps. Ramdin's bat intervenes
down leg again, pings off the pads towards fine leg for a run
driven to mid-on for a quick run. Samuels made his ground, but was he lazy in getting his bat down? The third umpire is called. He was but he just about made it.

given this time by umpire Brathwaite. Flat on middle and leg, skids on with the arm. The ball thuds into Samuels' pads in front of leg. This time the finger goes up. Samuels went deep in his crease but just missed his flick. Umpire's call at best/worst so a good decision not to review

straight to long-on. Pollard falls. Australia have two in two. Lyon has two in two. The same shot that got WI out of trouble in the previous game causes further misery for WI here. Tossed up on middle, some spin takes the inside half of Pollard's bat who looked to go down the ground with an uppish loft. That turn helped the ball lands straight in Warner's lap at long-on
some flight on off, Brathwaite comes forward to defend
shorter and wider outside off, Brathwaite defends off the back foot
superb bowling. More flight on middle, pushed into the off side
flatter, shorter, quicker. Brathwaite defends
starts with a flatter delivery outside off, slapped to cover
slower and shorter and wider, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
ripping turn. Slows it up outside off at 87 kph, beats the bat by a few miles
flight on off, draws Ramdin forward who outside-halves to third man. Lovely bowling
this time quicker through the air outside off, pushed to cover hurriedly
short and wide, mis-times a slap back to the bowler
dangled across off, Ricky aims a sweep across the line and misses
slides through outside off, jabbed to the cover region
drifting into the leg stump, this is loopier, Ricky goes low and squirts it onto the pad via an inside edge
fuller and quicker, Ricky skips back and glances to short fine leg
no turn, skids on, flat on off, defended from the crease
offbreak on the pads, helped away finer of short fine leg. Finch lumbers after the ball and keeps it to two
dropped fraction short and outside off, flat-bat slap to long-on. Ramdin swerves and ducks out of the way
Ramdin bends and meets a low full toss. Neatly paddled down to fine leg
quick fizzer, jabbed to cover
lovely legbreak, pitches on off and turns sharply past the outside edge. Ramdin stabs and misses
straighter one, swept behind square for one
an appeal for lbw! Umpire Llong shakes his head and shoots down the appeal. Skids on and hits the pad, pitched in line, probably heading down leg
breaks into the pads, knocked gently to midwicket
similar ball, worked to the right of the square-leg umpire
fired at 96ks, kept out
Ricky goes back and dabs a single to point
full and straight, picked away behind square on the leg side
helped off the pads behind square again
lobs a full toss on middle, whipped to deep midwicket
quicker legbreak, Ricky hangs back, prods and is beaten by turn
looks like a googly, swerved in, Ricky sits back and targets the leg side with a flick. He does not pick it and ends up popping it over Zampa's head via a leading edge
shorter and outside off, slapped to extra cover on the back foot
tossed on middle, defensively bunted to mid-on
slides on and turns outside off, chopped to deep point
length ball on off, blocked back to Maxi

an appeal for lbw, Maxi gets it to straighten, given! Pushed on middle, Ramdin presses forward and plays across the line and is trapped in front. Rapped on the front pad. No inside snick involved. Ump Brathwaite's call is vindicated. Ramdin's review amounts to nothing. The tracker shows it would hit middle. Maxi leaves the hosts six down
angled on off, played back to Maxi
leg-stump ball, diverted to the right of short leg
straighter one, Holder dead-bats it
lobs it full on middle, jammed back to Zampa. Toe-ended back
slides on outside off, tapped to the off-side sweeper
quicker legbreak, this time Ricky taps it to sweeper cover
bowled 'em! Holder rocks away outside leg and exposes all three stumps. Zampa takes aim and locks his target. He fires a slider and takes the off stump. The hosts are seven down
floated on middle and leg, poked back to Zampa off the inside edge
darted on the pads, Benn goes low and controls a sweep behind square
breaks in on te leg stump dabbed to square leg off the back foot
tickled from outside off to short third man
slides across off, bunted in front of point on the front foot
goes with the angle outside off from round the wicket, pushed to cover
an appeal for lbw, not given. Lyon gets it to straighten, but hits the batsman outside the line of off
turn and dip, prodded to square leg
full toss on off, Benn is surprised, squeezed out towards mid-on. Lobbed below waist line, Benn is a tall man
too full on off, driven to mid-on
full and no swing outside off, 150.6kph/93.6mph swished to mid-off now
yorker just a shade outside off, squirted to cover
full and swings away outside off, leaving Ricky prodding and missing from the crease
pitched up and angling away outside off, Ricky shoulders arms
Soft, soft dismissal. Khawaja pats Lyon on the head. Looped up on middle, may have stopped a touch on Benn. He has to check his push-drive, he ends up plopping it back to Lyon
full and turns away from Narine, beats the outside edge
drifts in on middle, defended to short extra cover
full on middle, Narine gets forward and drives it in the gap at the covers. First boundary for WI since the 9th over
flighted nicely on middle, Narine inches forward and smothers it
full and turns away, open-faced dab to short third man
full and outside off, run away to point
full and swings in on middle at 145ks, dug out
full and outside off, 140.4ks, ignored
full toss, swings in on off, 148ks poked out to cover
full and angling in outside off, guided to third man
hurled outside off, left alone
One-bounce four. Ricky tees off. Slides on off, Ricky did not get under it. He looked to loft and ends up slicing it to the long-off boundary
pushed on off, he presses forward and squirts it through square leg via an inside edge
flighted on the pads, bunted back to Lyon
He nailed that! Lyon slows this up on middle, the batsman likes the flight. He gets under this full ball and smokes it over midwicket. Clean swing, that
Lyon replies with an off-stump dart, defended
flicked off the back foot through backward square leg. Lyon finishes with 3 for 39
yorker, homing in on off from round the stumps, 147ks, squirted out
Starc ventures wide of the crease and zips in a yorker on middle, jammed back to Starc
angling into the hips, eased to long leg for a brace
wide of the crease 148ks yorker, dug out. Ricky can't do much
he aims for another yorker, bowls a half-volley outside off instead, carved to cover
full toss just outside off, slapped only to short extra cover
flighted outside off, milked down to long-on
tossed on middle, driven to short extra cover
legbreak, dabbed towards short third man for one

wrong'un and Zampa strikes again! Narine showed his ace early by dancing out. Zampa dangles a googly outside off, got it to dip as well. Narine aimed a hack across the line and did not touch it. Wade flips the bails off
fired full and dips at the leg stump, dug out hurriedly
75ks, change-up in pace, much slower and fuller, driven to long-off
off-stump yorker, tails in, squeezed to short extra cover
mighty full and homes in on middle, jabbed to cover. 148ks, that
full and darts back in at 142ks, beats the flick and pings off the pad towards the leg side
full and outside off, slashes and.... there was a noise - it came from the bat jamming the ground. No nick as the ball lodges in the gloves of Wade
short and angled in, kicks up rudely at the batsman, fends it towards point after loosening the grip
yorker, tails in, blocked down the ground, to the left of mid-on for four
lobbed up, may have been a googly, Ricky prods and gets an inside edge onto the pad
slider outside off, chopped to short third man
floated on off, 79ks Ricky has a big swing at it. He does not get under it. He has to settle with a sliced hit. Finch pouches it at the edge of the long-on boundary
a flat delivery on middle to start, Warner comes forward and blocks solidly
shortish delivery on off, a rank long-hop is pulled with disdain to the midwicket boundary. Easy pickings
slower offbreak outside off, Warner misjudged the length but went back to drive to long-off
flat on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket where Pollard makes a diving stop
ooh, the offbreak. Finch backed away and exposed his stumps. Hit it back

Ramdin thinks he has Finch. Maybe not. Slower outside off, Finch tries to go over cover but fails to connect. Finch's back foot was out but he dragged it back just in time. Just a smidgen behind. Nice keeping from Ramdin
nice running. A good length delivery, coming back in. There is no boundary to be hit, so Warner pushes to cover and sets off for one. Superb
good length outside off, some away swing. Loosely pushed to cover
nice lines. Fullish on off and middle, squeezed to midwicket. Even with a direct it at the batsman's end, Warner is comfortably in. A good run again
quite full outside off, driven into the cover region
too straight this time and easily flicked away towards midwicket who puts in a good diving stop
scythed through point. Not excellently timed but enough for Warner to get four. Too full, Warner drives from the crease and threads the gap at point. Nice stroke.
flat and straight, a turning offbreak is pushed back to Finch
flatter trajectory on middle, whipped to midwicket
more turn on off and middle, Finch is persistent on that back foot, backing away. Pushes to mid-off, a bit of miscommunication with Warner
Narine pushes it fuller and Finch comes forward, a thick inside edge to fine leg
nice bowling. Much fuller on off, prodded away by Finch. Aus need not do more against Narine
83 kph on off, Narine bowls a maiden. Finch backs away, trying to cut through point but mis-times to cover
shortish on off, Warner stays tall and steers a cut to third man. Played that nicely
a yorker on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
too straight and smashed. Phew, what timing on that. Just a flick and it whistled past square leg. First shot of such timing all day
and again. Poor bowling. Rather full, straight. Easy pickings for Finch as he whips another one through midwicket. To the other side of the square leg fielder. Runs flowing for Aus.
drifts down leg and flicked to fine leg. Exceptional running and two is easily made
full and straight, clipped to midwicket
flat on middle and leg, nurdled in the gap at backward square leg for a couple. Good placement
some flight on middle, blocked
shorter, still gets plenty of turn on that outside off. Warner pats it back
shot! Short! Too much width and Warner carves one through backward point for four. Fantastic placement. Warner is in some form
overpitched on leg, Warner doesn't need to do much to smother the spin and clip to square leg for a run
swept away for four. Tossed up on off, Finch gets low and places the stroke behind square for four. Really good timing
shortish on middle, pulled to square leg for a run
too straight, worked to square leg
a half-volley on middle is punched to mid-on who fumbles but no run
better from Taylor. Using the cutter on off, 125 kph. Defended
good length on middle, off the pad to square leg. A direct hit but Warner has strolled in
shortish on off, Warner manufactures a stroke by jumping out of the way and opening the face to dab to third man. He hustles back for the second, fantastic stuff
ooh, lots of turn. Slightly short and wide outside off, the ball waits and rips past the outside edge
excellent shot. Overpitched outside off, Finch opens up his stance and pummels the drive over cover with such ease.
shortens the length on off, turns away. Finch taps to point
fuller this time and wide outside off, the ball beats the bat
ooh, Finch beaten on the inside edge and a big appeal ensues as bat hits pad. Too leg side-ish for consideration
blocked off the front foot
fullish and wide, cracked through the point region for three more. Just keeps finding gaps, somehow.
back of a length, swerving back towards middle and leg. Finch misses his tuck. Hits him high on the pad
good length and straight, blocked

plumb in front! Full and straight, Finch shuffles across, trying to flick over midwicket but just plain misses a straight one. The umpire's finger was up quicker than I could say out. Easy decision, Finch doesn't bother reviewing.
fullish outside off, squirted to point
around the wicket, Holder digs one in with short fine leg in place. Khawaja gets outside the line and just helps it on its way with a nice pull. Past that fielder for four, easy.
shortish and wide outside off, slapped to long-off
too full on off, blocked
ooh, huge turn. Khawaja plays back, the ball goes easily past the outside edge
slowish on off, short enough for Khawaja to go back and play to point
flatter outside off, the knuckle ball, comes back in to off. Khawaja chops a cut to point
started that wider outside leg. Hence, Khawaja went back and kept it out easily
full on off, blocked into the off side. A loud yelp of "no"
slogged to midwicket. Wanted to go straight but the ball skewed off the inside half to midwicket, Pollard lets the ball go through with a naughty misfield
overpitched on off, driven into the off side
nice stroke. Too full and Khawaja leans on the drive and easily threads the gap at cover. Decent timing too
fullish length outside off, blocked into the off side
a smooth drive to cover to end the over
tossed up on off, punched to deep cover
some flight on middle and off, Khawaja stays back to defend
beaten on the outside edge. Lots and lots of turn from leg/middle to outside off. Nicely bowled
strays down leg, swept away towards short fine leg who gets a hand on the diving stop
tossed up on middle and leg, inside edged towards fine leg for another run
the knuckle ball to finish. Full on off, blocked confiedently
shot! Shortish on middle, Warner swivel-pulls to deep square leg
good length on off, cramping Khawaja for any room. Flicked to midwicket. Good lines
rather full on off, stylishly driven to mid-off
strays on middle and leg. Khawaja gets a fine tickle on that and sends the ball to the fine leg boundary. Easily done
another one. Four more. Too straight from holder, over-compensates and Khawaja nurdles to the fine leg boundary again
better comeback. Good length outside off and Khawaja blocks
tossed up on off, drilled to long-off
too straight, leg side-ish. Khawaja sweeps to deep backward square leg
slapped. On the bounce to long-off. Narine, from around the wicket, floats one up outside off
the knuckle ball on off, Khawaja reads it and defends
tossed up on off and Khawaja presents the full face of the bat to drive to long-off
overpitched on middle and leg, defended
tight line outside off, skewed to midwicket
too short on middle. Pulled to deep square leg
a good length on off, chopped to point
fullish on off, steered past point and Warner gets back for the second with ease

Khawaja sold his partner there. Back of a length on leg, the ball hits Warner's thigh pad and ricochets into Brathwaite's follow-through. Khawaja sets off and then says no. Warner makes it back though
fantastic running. Shortish and wide, crunched behind point and the first call was "two". He made it back easily
some flight outside off, Khawaja goes back to push to cover
full and wide, crisply driven to deep cover for a couple
beauty. Tossed up outside off, Khawaja strides forward but is beaten
shorter and wider, chopped into Ramdin's body
slower and wide, some flight, some turn. Left
and again, beaten on the outside edge by some turn
back of a length and angled in on middle from round the wicket, Warner backs away slightly and punches a single to mid-off
shot! Languid. A tad overpitched on middle, Khawaja flows forward and drives it ram-rod straight down the ground
veering into the pads, clipped to fine leg
short on middle from over the wicket, patted to cover for one
full and angled in from round the wicket to Khawaja. Stops a bit on him. Dropped gently into the pitch
looks like a cutter outside off, 109ks, check-pushed to cover
tossed and full on middle, crisply driven to cover
chopped from middle stump to point. Warner backed away outside leg and played it
Warner steps out and gets deceived in flight. He drags an inside edge to the midwicket region
Benn drifts this into middle, Khawaja sits back and pokes an inside edge to leg
sliding down leg, tickled to short fine leg
Benn gets Khawaja. Rather, Khawaja gives it away. Subdued celebrations. Drifts outside leg, sticks in the surface. Khawaja flicks early and spoons a catch to short midwicket
full and angled in on middle from round the wicket, Warner defends it to short midwicket
back of a length on middle, Warner goes a shade outside leg, drops it to mid-off, and sets off
back of a length on middle, Smith shuffles across and works to square leg
slower ball, cuts in just a shade outside off, check-pushed back to the bowler
back of a length and quicker outside off, Smith gets on top of the bounce and solidly punches to short extra cover
pitched up on off, Smith drives a single to mid-on. They take on Benn's arm
drifts on off and turns away, dabbed with soft hands to short third man
Smith surges down the track, meets the pitch of this full ball, and belts it back over the bowler's head
loopier and dips on off, Smith walks forward and taps it back to Benn
shorter and outside off, chopped to point for one
flighted and straight, worked to short midwicket
slider on off, cramps the left-hander for room. He looks to cut a not o short ball and nearly chops it back on
floater outside off, dabbed to cover on the front foot

Narine returns and strikes! Umpire Llong's finger goes up. Was that doing too much? Looked so. Biting offbreak, tossed full, from Narine, Smith is deceived and is rapped on the front pad in line with the stumps. Perhaps, curling down leg. Smith has to go though. He could have review it. The tracker confirms that it was slipping down leg
off-stump ball, dabbed to cover

Narine takes down Maxi for a duck! Big offbreak, rips in from outside off, shoots through the gate and nails the off stump. Maxi aimed a cover drive and missed. Two wickets in three balls for Narine. He still has the fizz
another offbreak, defensive prod from Marsh
another offbreak, inside-edged onto the pad
tucked off the hips to midwicket
tossed on off and turns away, poked out to point off the outer half
pushed through the cover-point region for one
slid in on off, Warner does not have enough room to cut. He chops to cover
turns in short on middle, played back to Benn
heading down leg, deflected to short fine leg

floated and turns in, hits the pad outside off? Inside edge? Umpire Llong turns down the appeal. Narine wants to challenge the decision. It would have hit the leg stump. It is a legal ball. No inside snick involved. Kisses the pad and drops in front of slip. Hit the pad marginally outside off
follows the offbreak with an off-stump knuckle ball, squirted out
tosses this offbreak, blocked back to Narine
swept from outside off to deep backward square leg. First run from Narine after nine balls
leading edge as Warner plays the flick early, loops wide of cover

short and quicker outside off, seam-up ball, 100ks, punched out to short-extra cover. Umpire Llong calls it a no-ball. The TV umpire may have relayed it to him. "Six fielders on the leg side" Llong says. The TV umpire now has another chat with Llong. Pollard then has a word with the umpire. But that was a late no-ball call. He had called the over and so that does not count as a no-ball. End of the over
drifting down leg, helped around the corner
jabbed to short extra cover
pushed past cover
tossed on middle, scooped behind square, wide of Ramdin
straighter one, blocked back to Benn
chopped from the stumps to point for one
slower through the air on off, Warner takes on Narine and launches him straight down the ground
short and wide outside off, slapped out to deep cover as Warner reaches his half-century
offbreak, squeezed to mid-on off an inside edge
lobbed up on off, defended to short extra cover
fuller on middle, eased down to long-on for one
big turn away from Warner. He pulls his bat inside the line and leaves it be
full on off, Marsh flashes a drive to extra cover
Marsh stretches forward and meets a full toss. Paddled to fine leg for three. Positive running
turns just outside off, jabbed to the off side

Warner hangs back and chops a single to short third man. He sets off for a single. Marsh, however, isn't as quick as Warner. But he slides his bat in and makes it. A direct hit could have put him in trouble
hint of turn away from the right hander, dabbed to backward point
slides on middle, a touch short, the batsman keeps back and defends it back to Benn
half-tracker outside off, swatted on the back foot to midwicket
another half-tracker outside off, forces a cut past the covers off the back foot
keeps it short and outside off, Warner reaches out and chops to short third man
Warner skips back and punches this short ball from outside off past the covers. Australia seal a bonus-point win
